title: Solomon's Covenant and Reign
shortSummary: This chapter records God's covenant with Solomon following the completion of the temple and Solomon's palace, emphasizing blessings for obedience and consequences for disobedience. It also details Solomon's political and military activities, including city building, alliances, and naval expeditions that expanded Israel's influence and wealth.
timeline: c. 970-930 BC - Reign of Solomon, Temple construction completed

keyCharacters.name: Solomon
keyCharacters.description: King of Israel who built the temple and palace, received God's covenant, and expanded Israel's kingdom through construction and alliances.

keyCharacters.name: Hiram
keyCharacters.description: King of Tyre who supplied Solomon with materials and craftsmen, and received cities from Solomon as part of their alliance.

keyCharacters.name: Pharaoh
keyCharacters.description: King of Egypt who gave the city of Gezer to Solomon as a dowry for his daughter, Solomon's wife.

keyCharacters.name: Pharaoh's Daughter
keyCharacters.description: Solomon's wife, daughter of Pharaoh, who moved into the house Solomon built for her in Jerusalem.

definitions.definition: Made holy or consecrated; set apart for God's special presence and purpose.
Forced labor or servitude imposed on non-Israelite peoples as a form of tribute or taxation.
A terraced structure or fill in Jerusalem, part of Solomon's building projects to strengthen the city.
A large unit of weight and money used in the ancient world, representing significant wealth.

outline.heading: God’s Covenant with Solomon
outline.description: God appears to Solomon a second time, confirming the temple’s sanctity and promising to establish Solomon’s throne if he remains obedient, but warning of judgment if Israel turns to idolatry.

outline.heading: Solomon’s Building Projects and Political Alliances
outline.description: Solomon completes the temple and palace, builds cities, and strengthens his kingdom through alliances, including the gift of cities to Hiram and rebuilding Gezer given by Pharaoh.

outline.heading: Labor and Administration
outline.description: Solomon imposes forced labor on remaining non-Israelite peoples but exempts Israelites, organizing his administration with officers overseeing the work.

outline.heading: Religious Observances and Naval Expansion
outline.description: Solomon maintains religious worship with regular offerings and incense, and expands Israel’s wealth and influence through a navy that brings back gold from Ophir.

application: Remain faithful and obedient to God’s commands to experience His blessings and covenant faithfulness in your life.
Recognize that turning away from God leads to consequences not only for oneself but also for future generations.
Use your God-given resources and opportunities wisely to build and strengthen what honors Him.
Maintain regular worship and devotion to God as a foundation for spiritual and practical success.

keyVerses.text: And if thou wilt walk before me, as David thy father walked, in integrity of heart, and in uprightness, to do according to all that I have commanded thee, and wilt keep my statutes and my judgments:
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the condition of obedience as the basis for God’s continued blessing on Solomon’s reign.

keyVerses.text: Then I will establish the throne of thy kingdom upon Israel for ever, as I promised to David thy father, saying, There shall not fail thee a man upon the throne of Israel.
keyVerses.significance: God’s promise to Solomon affirms the enduring dynasty of David contingent on faithfulness.

keyVerses.text: Then will I cut off Israel out of the land which I have given them; and this house, which I have hallowed for my name, will I cast out of my sight; and Israel shall be a proverb and a byword among all people:
keyVerses.significance: This verse warns of the severe judgment that will come upon Israel for idolatry and disobedience.

keyVerses.text: And three times in a year did Solomon offer burnt offerings and peace offerings upon the altar which he built unto the LORD, and he burnt incense upon the altar that was before the LORD. So he finished the house.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes Solomon’s commitment to regular worship and dedication to God upon completing the temple.
